result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron P. Polifka

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Defendant Cameron P. Polifka in court.  Attorney John Frank Kerscher appeared by video for Cameron P. Polifka.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF786.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on December 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:08 AM Defendant Cameron P. Polifka appeared by video.  Attorney John Frank Kerscher appeared by video for Cameron P. Polifka.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  September 30, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-11-22 at 9:00 a.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:42 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cameron P. Polifka in court. Defendant states that Atty. John Kerscher will be representing him and he is not available until next week.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
$2,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of first degree recklessly endangering safety.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs, except for prescribed medications taken in prescribed doses, and defendant is not to possess any weapons.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 07-05-2022
